intro: Knesebeckia papillosa, commonly known as the velvetleaf or velvetleaf morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, silky hairs, giving them a velvety texture. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple, typically blooming in the morning. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many climbing and trailing plants. Knesebeckia papillosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value and can be found in gardens and as a weed in cultivated areas.
